most often subdivided into Europe and Asia (red shades), while North and South

A 'continent' is one of several very large landmasses on Earth. They are
generally identified by convention rather than any strict criteria, with up to
seven regions commonly regarded as continentsâthey are (from largest in size to
smallest): Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and
Australia. "Most people recognize seven continentsâAsia,
Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and Australia, from
largest to smallestâalthough sometimes Europe and Asia are considered a single
continent, Eurasia."

In geology, continents are described by means of tectonic plates. Plate
tectonics is the process and study of the movement, collision and division of
continents, earlier known as continental drift.
